prefixDef.p: Private URIs using the teiCorpusHeader prefix are pointers to any element in the SHAWI teiCorpus document.
Private URIs using the share prefix are pointers to audio file residing on the SHAWI network share.
Private URIs using the geo prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a place element in VICAV Geodata list.
Private URIs using the zotid prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a biblStruct element in the TEI export of the VICAV Zotero Group library.
Private URIs using the dict prefix are pointers to the xml:id attribute on a entry in the SHAWI glossary.

spanGrp.span: The gazelle, my teacher. One day, there was a gazelle during the time of the Prophet, peace be upon him. The gazelle had children, meaning it had two or three babies. I don't know how many a gazelle gives birth to. I don't know.
She used to go and graze in the fields. She would go and graze, eating the grass so that she could produce milk to return and feed her young. Her babies were small.

One day, while she was going up the mountain to graze, there were hunters. We call them "Avcı" in Turkish. The hunters hunt the gazelles. They caught the gazelle, and as they were preparing to slaughter it, they had it among them.
In the past, they had what we call "Ok," which in Turkish is called "Ok." It means... — An arrow, or a dart. Arabs refer to it as "niššābe." We call it "Ok," so let's go with that.

When they had surrounded her and were about to slaughter her, she looked around, hoping to escape. But there was no way for her to escape. This was during the time of the Prophet Muhammad (peace be upon him), when she cried out: "Help, O Messenger of Allah! Help! I need your assistance. O Messenger of Allah, help!"

When she cried out, "Help, O Messenger of Allah!" the Prophet (peace be upon him) came to her aid. Those who had surrounded her, the ones who had set the trap, were Jews, and they recognized the Prophet. They saw how he stood by her side, ready to help her.
She said, "O Messenger of Allah, the Jews have captured me, and they want to slaughter me. I am calling on you for help. I left my young ones at home, and now I have milk in me."

She said, "Now it's time for me to go to them to feed and nurse my young ones. These people have caught me and want to capture me. Please allow me to go to my home to nurse my children, and after that, I will return. Let them slaughter me then. This is my request from you."

The Messenger of Allah, with his dignity and majesty (peace be upon him), said to the Jews, "O people, do you know me?" They replied, "Yes, we know you. You are the Messenger of Allah, Muhammad." He said, "This gazelle called out for help from me, and I came to her in haste. I ask you, if possible, to give her permission to go to her home."

Where her children are, her place, so that she can nurse her young ones, and then return to you so that you can slaughter her. They said, "Okay, O Messenger of Allah, we accept your guarantee. It is fine, we agree." They said, "You tell her." The Messenger of Allah (peace be upon him) said to her, "Go, and if you do not return, I fear that I will have to take your place.

If you don’t come back, they will slaughter me instead of you." She said, "O Messenger of Allah, I will go to my children to nurse them. And if I lie to you or deceive you and do not return, may Allah, in His glory and majesty, hang me in this world and the hereafter, just as He does with the rich man who does not give his zakat.

With the rich people who do not pay their zakat. Meaning, their fire is severe in the hereafter. May Allah hang me with the rich who do not pay their zakat, in this world and the hereafter, if I do not return." The Messenger of Allah said, "Fine, I guarantee your safety. Go in peace! I have guaranteed you!

He sent her, and she went back to her house. When she arrived, she began nursing her children, and as she saw them suckling from her, in the blink of an eye, they had drunk from her. She said, "My children, drink more, there is still milk inside me." They replied, "Oh mother,

We have drunk our fill. They said, "Go now, for the Prophet is going through a difficult time. Don’t cause him harm. I fear that if you go, they might harm him. They might strike the Messenger of Allah." The children spoke as soon as they finished nursing. They didn’t even want to eat.

One of them refused to eat and said, "Mother, go back immediately! Don’t worry about us; Allah will take care of us. You should return to the beloved of Allah, the Messenger of Allah, before the Jews proceed to harm him."

She immediately fed her fawns and returned to the Messenger of Allah. When she returned, the Jews looked at him in amazement at how the gazelle, after giving her word to the Messenger of Allah, had come back, saying what she had promised. She returned, willingly coming to face death. Now, they intended to slaughter her.

When the gazelle returned and stood before the Messenger, the Jews dropped their swords to the ground, raised their fingers, and declared, "I bear witness that there is no god but Allah, and I bear witness that Muhammad is His Messenger." They embraced Islam.

They recited the Shahada and said, "O Messenger of Allah, if a gazelle fears in this world and the hereafter, fearing death, fearing the fire of Hell, and says, 'May I be thrown into the fire of Hell,' yet still returns and offers herself as a sacrifice, then this shows us that our path is not the right one."

They recited the Shahada and embraced Islam. This was because the gazelle became the reason for their conversion to Islam—all of them, the Jews who had captured her and intended to slaughter her. May God bless you.
